result.execSummary:
All charges against Joseph Paul Koehler in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Paul Koehler is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on June 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

03:01 PM CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel.  ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Joseph Paul Koehler appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  22CF94 (PH), 17CF367 and 21CF377(STC). Court notes DE's request for modification, confirms DE is on a probation hold so cannot modify bond. Court calls 22CF94: S/T Tina Sitz, Justice Services Case Manager; direct by Atty Smestad.  Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Selmer. Attys argue bindover. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court notes revocation packet filed on 17CF367. Adjourned:  3:16 pm  Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

03:44 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Joseph Paul Koehler appeared from Jail. Includes 17CF367, 21CF377, and 22CF94. Court reviews case. Atty Selmer states DE is on a PO Hold out of Polk Co and agents name is mrs. Veil and agent Cormican state if DE signed probation revocation DE could be released today. Atty Selmer also makes statements re: DE employment and housing situation. Atty Selmer request Bond Modification. ADA Smestad makes statements re: probation revocation. Court reviews bonds in all cases. Court notes Bonds on all files have been paid. Court confirms address and phone number. Court finds good cause to exceed prelim time limits. Court sets PH in 22CF94 and STC in  17CF367and 21CF377. Adjourned 04:05 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

AMENDED 
- BOND ON FILE

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug/alcohol testing  random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad  DF:  Joseph Paul Koehler appeared from jail, pro se. Case called at 3:02 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. DE does not have counsel. Court reviews file. DE states he has not been allowed to contact PD's Office. Court security officer provides DE card with PD's information. Court makes findings to exceed time limits for counsel. DE posted bond. Currenly on PO HOLD. Directed to contact PD's Office today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
